title: Identity
description: Identity is used to clearly distinguish people that are interacting with digital experiences. Identity is established by an identity provider, which itself is referenced in the `namespace` attribute. Within each `namespace`, the identity is unique.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: Identity of the consumer in the related namespace.

authenticatedState.description: The state this identity is authenticated as for this observed ExperienceEvent.

primary.title: Primary
primary.description: Indicates this identity is the preferred identity. Is used as a hint to help systems better organize how identities are queried.

namespace.title: Namespace
namespace.description: The namespace associated with the `xid` attribute and matched up with the AAM data source integration code.

xid.title: Experience identifier
xid.description: When present, experience identifier value represents a cross-namespace identifier that is unique across all namespace-scoped identifiers in all namespaces.
